      Creates a string of length totalWidth, padded with the given paddingChar, such that the input is center-aligned in the output.

      static java.lang.String truncate​(java.lang.Object thing, java.lang.Integer lengthLimit)
      Truncates the string representation of the input object to the given length.
      Truncated strings will end with ..., unless adding it would make the output string longer than lengthLimit.
      If lengthLimit is not provided, then the string will be truncated to the length defined at DEFAULT_TRUNC_LENGTH.
      The shortest length that strings can be truncated to is controlled by TRUNCATE_MIN_LENGTH.

    • Method Detail

      • truncate

        public static java.lang.String truncate​(java.lang.Object thing,
                                        java.lang.Integer lengthLimit)
        Truncates the string representation of the input object to the given length.
        Truncated strings will end with ..., unless adding it would make the output string longer than lengthLimit.
        If lengthLimit is not provided, then the string will be truncated to the length defined at DEFAULT_TRUNC_LENGTH.
        The shortest length that strings can be truncated to is controlled by TRUNCATE_MIN_LENGTH.
        Parameters:
        thing -
        lengthLimit -
        Returns:
        The truncated input string, which will not be longer than the given lengthLimit

      • dateToStringFormat

        public static java.lang.String dateToStringFormat​(java.util.Date date,
                                                  java.lang.String formatString)
        Formats the input Date using the given formatString.
        Parameters:
        date - The date object to format.
        formatString - A valid String that is compatible with SimpleDateFormat.
        Returns:
        A formatted string representation of the given Date.

      • dateToString

        public static java.lang.String dateToString​(java.util.Date date)
        Formats the given date according to DEFAULT_DATETIME_FORMAT.
        Parameters:
        date - The date object to format.
        Returns:
        A string representation of the given Date with the format DEFAULT_DATETIME_FORMAT.

      • alignCenter

        public static java.lang.String alignCenter​(java.lang.Object thing,
                                           java.lang.Integer totalWidth,
                                           java.lang.String paddingChar)
        Creates a string of length totalWidth, padded with the given paddingChar, such that the input is center-aligned in the output.
        If paddingChar is not provided, the default padding character is just single-width space (" ").
        Parameters:
        thing - The Object to be center-aligned. The string representation from calling thing.toString() will be used.
        totalWidth - The length of the output string.
        paddingChar - The character (or String) used to align thing to the center in the output. If this argument is a String of length 2, then the output string will be roughly twice as long.
        Returns:
        A String of length totalWidth, where the input object is center-aligned.

      • align

        private static java.lang.String align​(java.lang.Object thing,
                                      java.lang.Integer totalWidth,
                                      java.lang.String paddingChar,
                                      boolean alignLeft)
        Aligns the string representation of the input object to the left or right of the output string, which will have length totalWidth, padded by the given paddingChar.
        Parameters:
        thing - The Object to be aligned. The string representation from calling thing.toString() will be used.
        totalWidth - The length of the output string.
        paddingChar - The character (or String) used to align thing to the left/right in the output. If this argument is a String of length 2, then the output string will be roughly twice as long.
        Returns:
        A String of length totalWidth, where the input object is left/right-aligned.

      • alignRight

        public static java.lang.String alignRight​(java.lang.Object thing,
                                          java.lang.Integer totalWidth,
                                          java.lang.String paddingChar)
        Aligns the string representation of the input object to the right of the output string, which will have length totalWidth, padded by the given paddingChar.
        Parameters:
        thing - The Object to be aligned. The string representation from calling thing.toString() will be used.
        totalWidth - The length of the output string.
        paddingChar - The character (or String) used to align thing to the right in the output. If this argument is a String of length 2, then the output string will be roughly twice as long.
        Returns:
        A String of length totalWidth, where the input object is right-aligned.

      • alignLeft

        public static java.lang.String alignLeft​(java.lang.Object thing,
                                         java.lang.Integer totalWidth,
                                         java.lang.String paddingChar)
        Aligns the string representation of the input object to the left of the output string, which will have length totalWidth, padded by the given paddingChar.
        Parameters:
        thing - The Object to be aligned. The string representation from calling thing.toString() will be used.
        totalWidth - The length of the output string.
        paddingChar - The character (or String) used to align thing to the left in the output. If this argument is a String of length 2, then the output string will be roughly twice as long.
        Returns:
        A String of length totalWidth, where the input object is left-aligned.

      • repeatString

        public static java.lang.String repeatString​(java.lang.Object thing,
                                            int count)
        Creates a string where the given Object is repeated for the given number of times.
        Parameters:
        thing - The Object to be repeated in the output. The string representation from calling thing.toString() will be used.
        count - Number of times to repeat the string. The absolute (positive) value is used.
        Returns:
        String where the given Object is repeated for the given number of times.
